dtbdh7p5u1BB9YDJKIFPVA.text: Far too over priced, honestly. I had the Cincinnati Chili Dog and it was ok, but the price was far too exorbitant for the food you're getting.  Reviewing the entire menu, though the burgers looked great, the owners of this establishment should have their heads examined placing prices like that on their items. I don't see this business lasting the long haul it they do not stop ripping folks off for decent to mediocre food items.

S5bGvVq7gOxD0vVBwHQ8EA.text: I think I just found a new favorite burger place. I had the steakhouse truffle burger and all I can say is WOW! So flavorful! I can't wait to go back and try the others!

zNBcRduGg1K5nfN82vA1uw.text: 10 Patty Burger Challenge Review:  Choose a burger with 3-14 pattys and finish it faster than the previous record. I did 10.   Ambiance: 4/5 I like how this location has an area a little separate from the bar area with booths that I could enjoy a meal with my family at without being right next to patrons that came to enjoy a sports event.   Taste: 5/5 Each of the 10 patties was a nice medium rare. It gets a little dry after the 1st 2 patties because there are not condiments between the layers. I think that's the norm though, as ever location has been that way, so I got a side of mayo. The onions, pickles, and other toppings are at the top and bottom of the burger, this has been at every location as well. It makes the bottom bun soggy, but that actually helps with getting down the last few patties.  Challenge description: 5/5 The challenge was as described, 10 patties, 10 pieces of cheese, and a normal amount of toppings.   Staff: The waitresses were nice, accommodating to my family and myself during the challenge, and supportive.  Time: 36:34  Difficulty: 4.5/5 (for the 10 patty And time)  Prizes: A shirt, and a free meal. Plus your record on the wall.  Thank you to everyone at cold beers do being so accommodating to me and my family.

dqg5sJnZBoHS0HQTF6INHQ.text: I came here with my boyfriend for a burger and beer and was not disappointed.  First of all, they listed the beers from lightest to darkest which made our selection super easy.  I wish more places would do this.  Second, our waitress was super awesome.  She gave us her recommendations before we explored the menu.  We weren't adventerous enough to try the PB&J sliders, maybe next time!  Lastly, the burger was really good.  1/2 lb burgers cooked at a perfect medium for me and medium rare for my boyfriend.    I will definitely come back here.

M26_eYkzNHaaE1b0Y2l4Hg.text: Okay I am a mac and cheese connoisseur and this place truly has the best Mac in my opinion! Whenever I have my Mac craving I come here. photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. Buffalo chicken totchos

DMX3_Nq8RrZ_ggJVBxGtSQ.text: Pains me to go 3 STARS here. I love this place. It's totally recoverable though. Let me explain.  Strong burger game here, damn near unparalleled. Great Atmo. Awesome service. Darcie and I sat at the bar and met Eric, our Bartender/Server. He was friendly, knowledgeable (esp on the 20 new beers on tap), dude was sporting a 1%-body-fat V-shape that should have had the ladies lined up out to Higley. Yeah, Darcie had NO issue sitting at the bar. But really, dude can't compete with my 52-year-old dad bod and beautiful bald head. Sometimes I just feel sorry for these handsome, young 2nd-placers. Yeeeeeeeee! ;)  Anyway. Adonis, er ah... Eric was awesome.  So, what went wrong? Thanks for getting me back on track.  #1 - The Pretzel Dip. The pretzels themselves are top shelf. They come out perfectly prepared, hot like the Sun, with texture to die for. {Needle rips across record} But DAMN! The dipping sauce is nasty. NazTAY! One try, and I was like: "Eric, gonna need a To-Go box for these two tasty pretzels."   I admit, I should have told him why. I should have said that I would be enjoying those pretzels a later time with a vastly superior dipping option called (Dun dun DA!) Tostitos Salsa Con Queso. But friends and neighbors, I had sat at the bar and started with a Space Dust. And you know damn well that cognition rapidly ebbs away as one of those disappears.  I think CB&C starts on the right path with their dip. It's got Nacho Cheese in it. Core success ingredient for sure. But then they add ASS. And things go horribly wrong. I would have been equally upset had I gotten some of it on the bottom of my shoe. Really, I was there about 6 hours ago and just typing this review has my lip curled, nose scrunched, and stomach somersaulting. Yikes! I'll add a sauce alternative at the end of the review... if anything, just to show I love ya and want to help.  #2 - The Side of Fries Jack. I would def prefer to exhaustively extoll the virtues of perhaps the best burger I have had in years, but the fry situation eclipsed said burger and pulled me down from cloud 9... and rivetted me in place. I could not stop thinking about the fact that I had paid $2 bucks for 27 fries. OK, typing that, it seems petty, but there were so few fries on my plate that it was easy to count them... and I could not stop myself from doing so. By easy, I mean, I did not have to move the burger or the onion rings on the plate and I did not have to whip out my finger and point while counting. 27. Nor were these fries huge. They were all less than 2" inches in length with most over 1.25". Sup Wit Dat? Did I tell my big homie Eric? No. Again. Space Dust. And I had moved on to a Coffee Kolsch (Oh my sweet Lord it was good).  So how do we restore the 5 STAR rating?  Let's start easy. Jump back in the kitchen and let the crew know they are executing in near top-notch form. Following the well-earned praise and encouragement, set the record straight that fries are not Bitcoin and should not be rationed as if they are. I really think this fry sitch was an oversite, but someone should really have noticed that quality/value deficiency. You guys get enough heat for being a bit pricey. Customer goodwill builds that return business and word-of-mouth.  OK, the pretzel dip. You can go so many far better ways. Here're a few:  a: Just go with regular Nacho Cheese. If this is already an option you should clearly state it. If it's not, please make it one for the love of God. Then retrain: "OK, with the pretzel order do you want your dip regular or nasty?" Actually, just completely get rid of that other dip atrocity.   b: Go premium with Tow Truck Todd's Queso -  -1 pack of Jimmy Dean Hot Sausage -1 block of Velveeta  -1 can of RO-TEL -1 or 2 diced Jalapenos In a medium pan or large skillet. Brown the sausage on medium heat. Pour off most of the fat. Return to heat. Thrown in the jalapenos. Cook 1-2 minutes. Begin adding the Velveeta in chunks to speed melting. Add the RO-TEL. Stir until fully melted and mixed. Drop heat to low and enjoy.   Todd's my buddy. He showed me the recipe, it's awesome, I'm a fan. And you will be too.  Guys, if I was running the show, I'd kill your current dip and go Regular Nacho Cheese and offer Todd's as a $1 upgrade.   Best of luck. I'll be back later, carrying a few extra STARS and high hopes.  Via Con Queso. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. Perfect pretzels, but the dip ruins the experience. I took my pretzels home for proper dip accompaniment. Read my review.

Uu_yRf9nC4mP2XpFZ8Htlg.text: I have left good reviews for this location before because it has been my local place but after Father's day I will naturally be more cautious. We arrived around 11:30 and I ordered the golden mustard wings. A few of them were cold and did not have much sauce. Perhaps sauce was just poured over instead of being tossed. After about 30 minutes of arriving back at home I was incredibly sick all the way through Monday afternoon due to food poisoning. Next time I'll stay away from the wings.

YVPRf0Iab3nphWaSyJqqvw.text: We ordered an appetizer didn't come out until moments before or our actual meal... but it doesn't end there e put our kids meal in with ours but she told us she put our kids food in before ours ? Why so our kids finished there food before we even got ours .. some family dinner. She came by and asked if we needed anything .. ya our food would be nice ? We didn't come out as a family to eat separate. Didn't make sense. Also when she brought our drinks she spilt it on my 5 year old sons head and didn't even acknowledge what she did just made a face and moved on .. won't be back Since then the management has contacted me and made things right with us I really do appreciate the owner contacting me about the experience that we did have

ydEyviTaTFMkJbbRRJuzMA.text: Came here for my birthday and got the 1000 island burger.  Bread was pretty dry, not very flavorful, I also got Mac and cheese with it and that wasn't very flavorful either, I didn't really see what the hype was about

aQZmySOrRzq2ak8aJfhaVg.text: Never got an update from the customer service lady.i have tried emailing twice now and gotten no response. Not even a phone call. Never eating here again.

C7wR5XV1TZRXrDLdzSsCdA.text: If you like a big messy burger and slow service then this place is for you!   Walked in here on a whim when Oregano's had a 40 minute wait and our party of 5 was able to sit immediately - there were a number of open tables.  Our issue was the slow and inattentive service. We got our menus right away and the server was friendly enough, but it took 15 minutes for her to get 2 bottled beers and waters. Then it took 50 minutes for our food to come out, it was late and we were already hungry so we were all quite hangry by that time. We didn't think it was a crazy order either - 4 burgers and a buffalo chicken. During that time, our waitress never came back to check on us or ask if anyone wanted another drink, refill waters, nothing. The guys at the table wanted to order more beers. She came back after the food was out to ask how it was but at that point it was a little late.  The food itself was pretty good. 4 out of 5 people ordered burgers, everyone liked their burgers but they were really messy. The buffalo chicken in a lettuce wrap was good but the chicken was a bit over-cooked. I'm told the fries were average but the coleslaw was good. The other nice thing is they had a gluten friendly menu which was helpful.  Overall pretty good food, but the experience was ruined by the service. It shouldn't have taken nearly an hour for burgers to come out on a Sunday night that was far from packed. And our waitress at least refilling drinks and letting us know the status of the order or checking in would have left a better impression.

ZwEANqZ1lCw5EJyR2eURNA.text: I love this place. Only 4 stars  because I ordered my burger medium rare but it came out decidedly medium. Otherwise great service, great beer menu, excellent selection of entrees! Our server Maddy was awesome!

QuOjwSrzeFkjdgwH3eo7SQ.text: Met my friends for lunch on Saturday & was tended to right away. The staff here are very nice & really helpful. Bought a gift card for one of the friends I was meeting up with for lunch...his Christmas present from me...& got that taken care of before each friend arrived.   Many tvs featuring different sports/games, music playing in the place. Not loud & overbearing like some sports bars are. Perfect ambience overall.   Waitress kept me hydrated with drink refills as I was waiting for my friends & she was just as awesome & efficient when my friends arrived.    Two of us ordered the Bacon Bleu (me being one of them), one got the Pit, & the fourth got the Reuben. 3 of us got the chips with our order, & the fourth got tater tots. Our food arrived in a timely manner & was very, very delicious!   I will say the food is a little pricey for my liking but very well worth it! I will definitely be back!

zkcqr6rTOmcifGlNaN4M0Q.text: Not sure what's happened. My friends and I have been coming here for over two years and the last few it feels like the twilight zone. I've seen my waitress four times in the past hour. We weren't allowed to order food when ready for some reason, and then we got to watch the two tables next to us be visited by our waitress a half dozen times and a manager or bar tender twice who offered to take their orders but ignored our waves and polite "Hi's." I'd like to think it's not because two of my co-patrons aren't white but the tables around us with adequate service weren't of mixed heritage and didn't have similar dearth's of interaction...  I wish it ended here but our orders weren't correct, I'm still waiting 30 minutes, and a completed plate later, for a condiment and I finished my dinner before one of the three entrees was delivered as ordered. Good news though... We're done so the waitress is super attentive about delivering and collecting our checks.

VBkH-Lx2JU2QxjZRqDLbnQ.text: Walked in with my family on a Saturday around 2:30 pm and it wasn't even many people in there. Why me and my family were waiting for 20 minutes for just our drink order is beyond me. Who we thought was out waitress finally showed up and took our drinks order then another waitress brings the drinks.  Now after she takes our orders our food comes maybe 30 minutes later. Now I couldn't even enjoy my Impossible burger because they had the doors wide open and flys began to attack us and I had to swat flies away from my kids meals. Mind you our waitress asked once how our food was while she ran off and didn't come back for a while because she was waiting the whole restaurant. I honestly felt like the food was okay it all taste like we were just at a cookout in our backyard and for the price we paid it would have been cheaper. I will probably never return to the Chandler location.

lsCN19mdY3RuD29QTfC_kw.text: I came here for my birthday 2 years in a row. Andrea was my server. Food was great but the service was phenomenal. Everyone from the hostess to the other girls working were so friendly and accommodating. I love this place!

1HDM6iU5cEuMBaWGhkoTDg.text: Went here for the first time yesterday after driving by numerous times. I really liked the atmosphere. It's a great place to catch a game while drinking a cold beer. The food was okay. We had the buffalo chicken dip which was IMO way too spicy to enjoy. For dinner I tried the Mac and cheese burger which I asked to be cooked medium, and a side of onion rings. The burger came out too dry for my liking and quite honestly the taste was bland. I've had better Mac and cheese burgers at the Cheesecake Factory. My BF had the Steakhouse burger which he said was decent but really rich. He got a side of the sweet potato tots which were tasty. The best part was ordering the table side smores. They bring out a plate of graham crackers, chocolate and marshmallows and you are able to roast the marshmallows right at your table... Pretty neat! We'd probably go back again for beers and a game but the food was meh.

4C-9Gg-bg_KZpHe73p__pA.text: First time here was a for a happy hour.  Despite being packed the service was excellent.  Every drink, appetizer, and meal was delivered promptly.  For me if the service sucks nothing else matters.  Since service was great let's talk about the food.  I tried their Hell Fire Chips as an appetizer.  The name says it all.  Very spicy but good.  I ordered a regular burger for the main course and it was delicious.  Juicy and cooked perfectly.  Now for the beer.  I like amber and brown beers and their selection is fantastic.  If there was one negative it would have to be the parking.  I went during happy hour on a Friday so I expected it to be busy but parking was a pain for my group.  I was able to find a spot in the strip mall parking lot but other people in my group needed to park down the road.  I don't consider this a big enough negative to take a star away.  I highly recommend Cold Beers and Cheeseburgers.

8tWd-qjkUVrk4SQeBMMwvQ.text: Place was a pleasant surprise. Lots of tvs. Bacon Bleu burger and buffalo chicken totchos were excellent. Hannah was a great server.

4Uk6KAoazI_Sl3xyEkptow.text: The burgers are AMAZING! I built my own and hubby had the steakhouse truffle burger. Both were great. Only complaint is service is just OK... Got seated by the hostess at a table made for 4 but we had 5 in our party she was supposed to get us another chair but we waited until our waitress got there and she finally got us a chair. We didn't get enough silverware or appetizer plates even after getting appetizers so we ended up taking them off the table next to us... My son ordered a Sprite and she brought all the adults at the table our margaritas and never brought my sons drink. It was busy though so I get things can get chaotic. Food is a bit pricey but really good, I just really don't think fries should be a $2 up charge... Burgers typically come with fries... Get the chips that come with it instead they were actually much better than the fries. If I didn't love my burger so much I may never go back but I would say we will return at least for happy hour.

rtDnMfttGN3fiXoYqza8Gw.text: Our server June was friendly and very helpful with the menu.  The food was served hot and fresh and everything was excellent. The drinks came out quickly and tasted great too. We'll definitely be back.

_L48Yeik7Qa0SIle52g1gw.text: Nice concept but service was very slow. Waite staff was more concerned with their cell phones than their customers. Ordered a "build your own" burger and it came out wrong but gave up on trying to correct it because again staff was focused on their phones not their customers! Probably will never return and defiantly will not recommend to friends.

OW9wehWT1Hv5AuLnSXCzZQ.text: My friend and I ate at the pub tonight and everything was excellent. The server, Rachel told us about the "build your own burger" special and it was great.  She was friendly and personable yet efficient and professional.  She provided just the right kind of help, not too much and not annoying but just when you want something she was there, only too happy to give extra and above customer service..  It is only the second time I have eaten there, and I can say with all honesty, it is constantly good.  This was a great treat for both of us.

_PnnAfSqA56l_tcn8shl7Q.text: The burgers were juicy and good. The service by Hannah was excellent.  The restaurant  and bathroom were clean. Overall very good experience.

oeFursl2vqDu1av96uRJUQ.text: So I'm giving a 2-star opposed to one the service wasn't that bad. Especially since it was a Friday at happy hour. He had a decent size group login and had a table at about 5 ish clock. She did not know happy hour specials for preferred not tell us because had I known that there were many specials like craft beer and appetizers I would have gotten food. Unfortunately I was not informed of any of this and just got a beer. Then I was not informed that happy hour ends at 6 p.m. opposed to 7 p.m. like some places and being 5 minutes late after happy hour I was still informed that it ended she did not check on us beforehand to see if we wanted anything before happy hour ended. So I can't tell you how the food on happy hour taste for how the craft beers on happy hour were because I was not informed and then not even allowed to get a regular beer after happy hour. Not a good experience will not be back

EYe-F427uAjdbi90tqaFZA.text: My son introduced me to this place and I loved it from the start. Service is great and so is the food!!

admHwDzUyPZhiq9dCvMFBg.text: My favorite burger place in the world. The burger is a 5/5 hands down. They offer great customization and have a lot of unique burgers. The service however leaves a little to be desired. I often don't mind an inattentive server, I don't like to be in a rush when I eat, but they push that boundary even for me. I was also extremely dissapointed when they started adding an extra charge for French fries. IMO if you pay 12+ dollars for a burger the fries should always be included.

uAzkfXBr8wAgKpGu9MY5VQ.text: Stopped here last night to catch the NCAA basketball final.  Great sports bar atmosphere with TVs everywhere.  Waitress was excellent!  Super friendly, attentive and accommodating to our special request that was not on their menu.  Beer was cold with a huge beer selection, appetizer was good and the burger was fantastic.  Great time with a fun atmosphere.

XXn5D5oW2XNiO7dJGp3Yew.text: Worst sports bar I have ever been too. Service was terrible and the food was overrated. The fries we ordered were cold and the burger that we got was under cooked with blood coming out if it and when I tried to take it back the waitress gave me such a hard time about it. Don't waste your money here!

aZrJYdLF8Y4QOFHfHlos0Q.text: We have been going to this location since it was Uncle Bears and have been 3 times since the change over to CB&C. First time was great. Sadly enough we will never return after our last adventure. On a not so busy night our food took far too long to arrive. After ordering my burger on the well side of medium, taking my second bite I thought to myself I didn't order guacamole or any other item "cold, slimy, pasty" on my burger.  I was right, I didn't! What I was feeling was 100% uncooked, raw meat. I never and I mean never send food back. I did this time as it was disgusting at best. They cooked me a new burger, that I choked down. No manager apology, no break on the bill. And fun is just to begin. It hits me ten minutes after getting home. I will spare you the details. COLD BEERS & CHEESEBURGERS & FOOD POISINING!!!!!!!!!

YNMUt-vcMaRs8GrNcjJjbw.text: I was hesitant to try this restaurant due to the mixed ratings here on Yelp but decided to give it a try since the couple we were with wanted "American food". We arrived at about 6:15 on a Saturday evening. Parking is a challenge, they do offer complimentary valet but after one pass through the parking lot we found a self-park spot at the far end of the lot. Our group of four was greeted promptly and found that it would be about a 15 minute wait for an inside table or we could be seated outside right away. We opted for outside on the patio. It is smoke-free and shaded plus the misters were doing a great job at cooling, it was very comfortable outside. Multiple TVs all around showing a good variety of football games. Each of us ordered a different type of burger and everyone was happy with their orders - the Juicy Lucy, the Hangover, the Bacon Bleu and the All-American, each was cooked perfectly and the even medium-well was still nice and juicy. I recommend trying the sweet potato tots for your side. Yes, it is generally between $11 and $14 for a burger ($18 for a double!) - not cheap but beer was cold and burgers were flavorful. Our server was friendly and attentive but did not rush us as we enjoyed a couple of beers before placing our order. Next time we will skip dessert, the brownie sundae was pretty basic and not really worth the $6.  All in all a nice night out and we will be back.

AHplQWdmo1xh2Y1PrWmjqw.text: Today was my first time here since Uncle Bear's closed.  I came alone after a day of moving into a new home, was hungry and thirsty and this place is nearby.  I sat at the bar, and ordered a beer and a plain old hot dog and fries.  Just one order for just one me.  The beer was great, and the beer was all I had for about 30 mins, and the bartender was MIA.  A server appeared and brought me not one but two  orders of hot dogs that had stuff on them I did not request and wouldn't request.  I explained to her what my order was for, and she repeated it all as if I just changed my order.  She went away, and a few mins later the bartender resurfaced, noticed I had no food but didn't say a word; she went to the kitchen, came back and said they will fix my order, and confirmed that I really wanted a plain dog with fries.  When I added "they brought me two, I just need one", I didn't get much of a response.  I quickly received my original order, and the server seemed very perturbed to have to be doing that.  (Sorry my not wanting the wrong order has irritated you?)  The bartender didn't utter a word to me the rest of my visit, and left at the end of her shift without letting me know someone else would be helping me.  (I figured that part out as I watched her grab her purse and leave, then noticed a Ninja bartender guy looking my way and asked him for my check; thanks bartender guy!)  The food was great.  The service was horrible (except the bartender guy).  Maybe I just came in on a bad day.  (And I was polite the entire time, so no, I wasn't one of those nasty customers lol!)

xmdfSAs_HfcyGMj9R0uKFw.text: My husband and I recently relocated to Chandler,AZ and our first experience was at the Scottsdale location. Our experience there was good and we enjoyed sitting on the patio.  I decided that I wanted to keep it low key for my birthday dinner this year with us being new to area and not really knowing anyone so we decided to give the Chandler location a shot. I LOVE smores and they have that on their dessert menu so it seemed like a good fit. Well... it wasn't. The entire staff ,except for the manager and the sweet food runner,  looked like they hated their jobs. RBF everywhere.. We were seated inside bc there wasn't any seating outside which wasn't a problem. Once sat, our server didn't come to get our drink orders for at least nine minutes. We just sat there ignored. When are server did come up she asked what we wanted to drink abruptly and walked off... I tried to give her the benefit of the doubt that maybe she was rushing and overwhelmed.. no.. her entire interaction with us was rude and abrupt.. I tried to ask her a question.. she said what's up? When we did get our food, my sandwich was on white instead of whole wheat.. when we could finally flag her down to let her know the sandwich sat on the table for another five minutes before they came to get it to switch it out. My husband ordered small beers, they continued to bring him large beers.  All in all it was a bad experience. The food was okay but the service made it much worse. By the end of it I didn't even get my smores bc I was so sick of the bad service that I just wanted to leave.

rFq-53WZP6MCZKBsOtd3hw.text: Not much to say besides this place has horrible service and the food is typical burger and fries. There is nothing special about the food- the cheese sauce that you get with pretzels is disgusting. The only good item is the specialty chips. I wouldn't waste money here.

4Yj-advgl4olDfYe2J02hg.text: So, I hear about this place called Cold Beers and Cheeseburgers & since I am a cheeseburgeraholic I decide to try it out.  We went there last night & ordered build your own burgers, tots, onion rings & beer on tap.   It took forever to get our food & the service was horrible.  After eating we headed home for the evening.  We did not eat anything else when we got home.  Within an hour my wife's stomach is upset & a little while later I am feeling like heck as well.  OH MY GOD we have food poisoning.  Well, up & down all night puking & on the toilet.  Twenty four hours later & we still feel like heck!  Called them & asked to speak with the manager.  He gets on the phone & is so obtuse about what has happened to us.  Says sorry & hangs up.  Doesn't even ask how we are doing now & if they can make it up someway.  I have our leftovers & I am calling the Health Department tomorrow.  This place was also filthy & the menus & tables were sticky& gross.  Take my advise go to Five Guys or Smashburger for a far superior burger & fries.  If I could I would rate them a negative 10.  This place sucks.

yWYXe22skJ8LHrbaq9z_TA.text: Stopped in for lunch. Only bad thing was parking. Lots of businesses around so for all businesses in this area parking is bad. I had the juicy Lucy. Cooked to order - a perfect medium. No need for condiments. Each element made it a very good burger. Also best tater tots. Next time I try the totchos.

lRBq7LwLi69YxxrTHiEMlA.text: Booked the bus to the Cardinals game and that was a huge mistake. The bus is overcrowded and way too loud not to mention I would have gotten there quicker driving myself. All that aside, the burgers are over priced and mediocre. They come with chips but if you want fries it is $2 more. We paid $45 for two burgers and two beers for lunch. The service was very attentive though.  I won't dine here again.

kdYKxsqQf2Ieb9T1au8PYA.text: Out here from Cali visiting the folks, and found CB&CB on Yelp (of course they have already been here).  After checking out the pics, how could we not start with a half order of Totchos with extra queso.  Holy crap!  They were outstanding.  I would definitely recommend this not only as a starter, but possibly even as a meal.  Very filling.    I was sad to hear they stopped carrying San Tan Mr. Pineapple, but no biggie... Mr. Coke was right there waiting.  I got the Open Pit burger, and it didn't disappoint.  Probably could have used a bit more BBQ sauce.  Housemade chips were also good.  The folks got the All-American burger which is a bargain at $8 from the HH menu, how could you go wrong.    All in all, a great food experience.  Plenty (and I mean plenty) of TVs to watch.  When I'm back in Chandler, I'll be back at CB&CB!

sicrqlc7xkpXU4s7No6CeA.text: This is a fantastic restaurant! And I don't review restaurants very often. The food was awesome, the service was great, and they were very accommodating when it actually got cold here. They moved us under a heater and there was 12 of us.  Great job!

H4FNpOpBNrpmCqIELX2Hmw.text: Be prepared for disappointment if you choose to BYOB "build your own burger" as the kitchen got all 3 of our orders incorrect. From cooking temperature (med-well came out med-rare) to additional add-ons (cheese, avocado, etc) will be missing. Server went to fix with no problem and the manager Derek B. came by to ,I can only assume confirm mistakes, which he then asked "what's wrong with the order?" as we repeated the mistakes he proceeded to ask us to "check our attitude" as if answering his question was rude?! He then went on to say WE made the server uncomfortable, we repeated she was perfect, our disappointment was with him and his lack of decorum. He then yelled across the dining room "yes our servers are perfect, apparently just like all of you!". What. A. Professional?!  Find a Cold beer and Cheeseburger LITERALLY anywhere else.

ewRNT641r1X_8vfAkU-K8A.text: This location does not ooze the same vibe as the one in Scottsdale.    The servers are rather slow - we were seated with no utensils - we requested some soon as we got our order and we were halfway done with food before we got them.  The beer on tap tasted stale.   The buffalo sliders that I tried were soaked and mushy at the bottom! Yuck!  My kids enjoyed their Hangover burger - though the onion rings were more batter than onions.   Overall, not a good experience. :(  We probay wont return for a while.

Qd1fFlLIY0h3FXoSwDoRaA.text: Ok. So there are quite the variety of reviews on here, so I almost decided not to go.   But I am glad I did.  I have had some prior experience with CB&CB, in Dayton Ohio. That location was terrible, as far as food goes. And, no surprise, it eventually went out of business.  So I was hesitant to try this one.  They insect(flies) situation wasn't as bad as others have posted, when I was there. I did notice quite a few of them buzzing around..but I never had to swat at any of them for getting too close.  The hostess was nice. And so was my server, Brittany.  I ordered the CB& CB burger; Burger with carmelized onions, and a garlic aioli. I asked for it med/well. I think it came out closer to medium..but it wasn't cold and raw..so I could deal with it.  That was the only complaint I had for the burger.  Otherwise, it was big and tasty. I got the regular tater tots as my side.  YUMMM!  They were crispy, hot, and seasoned great!  Kinda lame that they charge you an extra 2 bucks for those.  They have a huge selection of beers as well.  I will be back.

q6nj3bbh1kM1HSAMdncT6A.text: Finally a place that ensures Uncle Bears is a place to be forgotten.   So we start with forgiving the owner for the giant Red and White flag in the front. It is sort of like wearing the UT color and horns as well...it is like a big old badge of "too dumb to know any better". But roots are roots...look at Baltimore. Roots sets society back more than 100 years.  Forgive and forget, right?  Let's start with greeting by the beautiful hostesses. Been to this place 4 times now...the place is always busy but we have never had to wait for a table. Really like that!!!  Burgers are phenomenal. Beer selection is even better. Waitresses are at the top of their game...oh and you can catch any game there from any angle. Watch out for the side of sweet potato tots...for a couple of bucks they would happily satisfy a table of 4 to 6.   This is my favorite place to get a burger...it should be yours too!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. A beer for every day of the week!

UvyIp7B_ZZeRVrB4JZ-a1w.text: Saturday night, be ready to have trouble parking. The developers of the complex didn't think that through.  I tried the PB&J burger, not terrible...but the truffle fries were way too garlicy. They have a great selection of local (and non-local) beers, and service was good!  Nice patio with heaters and a good mix of high and low top tables. They also had a fire with some patio furniture around it. We'll definitely be back.

52jF5MNdAAWpCBls_aK91A.text: My experience here was average. However, be warned! Both my boyfriend and I left a 20% tip and when we checked our bank statements the next day we were both charged double what we tipped. Check your account after!!! I called the manager about this and they were nice enough and refunded me the extra amount I was charged but offered no real explanation for the overcharge. More should have been done over this. It seems like the waitress tried to claim more than we tipped. Soo shady!!!

j4VIZUJTYOMp09P7X2IDbg.text: Went in and asked to get a channel on.  Justin, the manager, said we only have 10 satellites, and I can't get your channel.  Really?  You just changed a TV with MLB on to another channel with a hoops game on that was on another TV already.  You are losing this argument.  I hope they fire you.  Very bad customer service.

IO4ohRVp7EqcdeMM3z8cBg.text: We came here and got a burger asked for it med and let's just say it was very cold and raw in the middle (so raw ,raw ,raw) told our bar tender Austin to please show the cook .we made a ball with the raw meat  and told him I hope we don't get sick and to please show the cook so he knows . (Yes we ate most of it )He said he would as he put our plate in his tub and continued to serve other people.sorry but this is heath hazard and Truly not ok...Only reason I gave it a two stars was because it's clean and nice and had good flavor even for a raw burger.. ohhh yeah homemade chips were horrible and I usually love all home made chips these tasted like old grease  and nothing else

oCgJAI9Uef1Yuo2STc2pdQ.text: Came in excited to eat here because we were very hungry and ready to eat "award winning" burgers. We came in and yes our server was very nice but our wait time was stupid long. There isn't anyone here and yet our order took more than an hour to come out. Then on top of that our food was cold. I get sometimes food can take forever but never this long. I can just imagine how it is on their busy nights. Never again coming here. Also the manger was very rude when we talked to her about the issue. As a manger you need better customer service.

kfvZWE5AlSTtK9kKlsleyg.text: I tried this place for the first time awhile ago and the PB&J sandwich that others were hesitant to try was awesome.   Although I am typically a PBR and Tequila guy I was happy to see the Leinenkugel's sign since being from Wisconsin and my fiance went to school with the owners.  I was disappointed they only had only one choice of it.   Oh well, other than that the service was good but a bit busier than I like. ( i prefer a quieter setting)  All in all I give it a thumbs up and will try again sometime. I do prefer Wimpy's in downtown Chandler though.

Dh47dg4HVfk1-cDKYcBHUA.text: Was greeted by friendly hosts, offered a drink right as I sat down, and checked on by 3 bartenders! Great service as always

BouV-OH6xZVRZIaLFEmsFA.text: Went with a work group and had below par service. I took into consideration that it was a Friday night but a long wait 20+ minutes for our first drink order and she also brought out a shot "on the rocks" and no one asked for it that way. The food on the otherhand was out of this world. We ordered a Hangover burger but got the patty stuffed like their Juicy Lucy for $15. We were very impressed at the taste and presentation of the food. Parking was terrible too, we had to actually park at the CVS and walk across the street to get there as the entire lot was full!

-ocsaoc1sKhcJ5PX-cdi2Q.text: My husband and I have been here a few times.  The food is really good!  They also have a good set up of tvs and a large selection of beer.  However, if you drink mixed drinks be prepared to pay for an overpriced WEAK drink.  This place does the "corporate pour", so the drinks are really weak.  My husband and I were talking about how weak my margarita was, and a bartender blurted out "We put a whole shot in it".  REALLY?  a whole shot?  Wow.  Then she said she would have to charge us extra if we wanted it stronger.  Meanwhile the margarita was already overpriced for the tiny amount of tequila in it.   If you want a REAL mixed drink, go to a family owned bar where the bartenders are allowed to make their drinks the way the want to and the way they should.  You can get a better made margarita at a cheaper price elsewhere.

6KBfjgSautFV-mjOxLAQPA.text: We did return last week for the first time in about a year.  This time we arrived early and didn't have to hike the parking lot.  However the service this time really was sub-par.  Twice I had to wave my arms to flag my waitress down to get her to visit the table, refill drinks, etc.    Aside from the service, here's the thing that drops my rating to two stars:  I ordered onion rings with my burger.  When my food arrived, there was no ranch, bbq sauce or other condiment to dip my rings in.  I asked for some dressing.  When I got the bill I found I was charged for a couple ounces of dressing.  Now, when you charge between $11 and $18 for a burger and chips, do you REALLY need to tack on another 50 cents for a small condiment serving.  It's not the amount, it's that you have to nickel and dime your customers when your prices are already premium.  I could buy a pizza and feed a family of four for what you charge for a cheeseburger and chips.  Do you really need to add that extra .50??  This time, in order to keep the tab in the two figure range, we skipped the beers.  It was "Cold Water and Cheeseburgers", LOL!!  I was genuinely surprised the water was free.  Again, just to balance the review, the food was, as always, amazing.  The host staff at the front door was friendly and we were welcomed and seated quickly.  We will probably be back.  Unlike other restaurants in the area, CBCB is not one that we will visit with any regularity.  Edit: One last thing.  If you get the "Juicy Lucy" burger (my first time), don't cut it in half.  There is a hunk of melted cheese in the center that liquifies as it cooks and will squirt all over your clean shirt and shorts the minute you plunge a knife into the burger, thus ending the "Juicy" part of "Lucy" and leaving you with a dried out burger and a laundry pre-soak job.  Careful biting into it also.

ui5PSju_kl7rltq-oERcLw.text: So, at last I had the opportunity to try Cold Beers & Cheeseburger. Decided to check it out on a Saturday night! You can feel the energy when your walk into the building! Probably one of the better sports bars I've been to in awhile! Televisions everywhere, enough to keep you hanging out for awhile to watch your favorite game! I decided to try a cheeseburger and needless to say, you get your money's worth. Probably the biggest cheese burger patty I've had in a very long time. Puts Red Robin to shame! Food was cooked to my liking and served in a timely fashion. Chips were a little over cooked, but still good enough to eat. Waitress were friendly and responsive. Overall a very fun sports bar experience! Would recommend if you are trying to catch a game with a group of friends on the weekend!

Hqywnjoo9QjjPzxtFeNg_A.text: This is a great place to go to to hang out with friends or to watch sports. I especially love coming here on Mondays because of their Mac and cheese promotion. For $12 you get unlimited toppings. They have a preset menu that you check off what toppings you want which includes all different kinds of vegetables, cheeses and meats. The portions are big enough that you definitely have enough left over for a second meal. Other things on the menu that are good are their tot chos which are nachos made with tots instead of chips. Delicious and not nutritious. You can also make your own s'mores. They bring what looks like a Bunsen burner and you roast your marshmallows over it. This location also has a fireplace outside for the winter time.

kOKfpl-KaIh7qT0Tf7UkHQ.text: I've come here a hand full of times now and every time I have had a great experience, friendly servers, fast service. I love the PB&J Bacon cheeseburger. It's an interesting mix of sweet, salty, and a little spicy from the chipotle sauce. I always get it with the tater tots. The pretzel is good too, the cheese sauce tastes like chili cheese.   My last visit was 7/25/19, the table next to me was being extremely rude to the waitress, complaining about anything and everything. Not even valid complaints just people looking to be jerks. The waitress maintained a respectful and professional composure, she did a great job!

pQniXd3RLxgH1SvAhPvrcw.text: Our last visit was in March 2015 and I gave them 1 Star (read that review and you'll see why) and we waited over 4 years to try them again. For some reason they simply can't get an order right. I'm not entirely sure where the blame rests either on the cooks or the servers but it's been an issue on both visits.  We sat at the bar again and were greeted right away. I got the JD Lemonade and subbed Titos Vodka instead of JD and my wife did the same with her Cucumber Sun instead of Gin. Both drinks came quick and were excellent. They also brought us waters without having to ask. Much appreciated.   We started with the Jumbo Salted Pretzel w/roasted pepper cheese sauce. I highly recommend. We both went with the BYOB burger and added fries. From a price perspective it gets a bit ridiculous to have a $16.00 burger that comes with chips and you have to pay a $2 up-charge for fries. $18 for a burger and fries is pushing it quite a bit.   My burger came out as ordered and was excellent. My wife's came with BBQ sauce which she didn't order and can't stand. The bartender apologized and said we'll remake that for you. It took over 15 min to return with her meal and instead of remaking her BYOB they remade mine for her. Completely different than what she ordered and since I like mine spicy and she doesn't she wasn't going to just eat it considering how long it took and the fact that I was already finished with my meal. At this point we were ready to go and didn't want to wait for another remake.   In the end the bartender took the cost of her meal off the bill but didn't do anything else to compensate for the fact that she didn't eat. If I were the server I would've got the manager involved, insisted we remake her meal so she could at least take it to go and deduct something extra off the bill to make it right. She essentially did nothing and our 2nd visit ended much like our first visit in disappointment.

UYldAoY2lmMADvJuwTB7OA.text: AFTER THIS REVIEW i was reached out to and offered gift cards to make it right which I have yet to receive. If they reply here it's just to save face. They really don't care about your experiences.   Super sad because this place is relatively new to the area, and super close to my apartment. They serve the impossible burger and it's a great place to watch sports! However, the service is terrible. I've been there twice and it's just awful. Slow, rude, my order never comes out the way I want it. Last night a few friends and I decided to go there and literally it took an hour and half to get our COLD food, yet the burgers were burnt! The waitress would stop by and ask if everything was ok and leave before we could even answer. I spent $40 on a below average cold meal and crappy service. Not my best choice!

cT1Bd2SQglJ9AMe35M5wXQ.text: I'm no cheeseburger lover but these cheeseburgers are so good! I would typically order anything but a cheeseburger but I tried one and I liked it! I don't want a dripping juicy burger so I ordered mine medium well and it had the best grilled flavor as if I had grilled it at home.  We sat on the patio trying to escape all the TV's and the noise so we didn't have to scream at each other, we didn't scream but there was no escaping the tv's.   Great service also!

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States

TX2x1bmtqNRFtbP7D314iA.text: What was really disappointing about our meal here is that the burger patties were quite overdone. We both ordered our burgers medium and got them well-done. In fact, my patty was more than well done and therefore very dry. For a restaurant that supposedly specializes in its burgers, this is a big no no.   We upgraded one of our sides to Truffle Fries for $5 and they were not worth it. They were tossed in some herbs and grated Parmesan- none of which stuck to the actually fries- so you'd end up with a bite of a normal French fry and a little pile of herbs and Parmesan at the bottom of the bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. Truffle fries. Tastes just like normal fries but with a tiny bit or herbs and Parmesan on top. Not worth the $5 upgrade.
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. The Pit. BBQ sauce, onion ring, cheese. Good flavor but the patty was over cooked.

lLjFO4FJp6giYbDwcnKh0A.text: We could've had Jimmy John's or New York pizza, but today our choice was Cold beers and cheeseburgers. Yes, that's the complete name of the restaurant, "cold beers and cheeseburgers".  So I started my evening with a cold beer. I drank  the lumberyard red. Worth giving this beer a try, I found it was better tasting than the Killians red that you've probably had before. Plus, I haven't noticed Killian's in the retail stores for a while.   OK, I didn't feel like eating the namesake cheeseburger today, so I gave the prime rib dip a try and was totally pleased.   Juicy beef Prime rib with cheese nicely laid out on a fresh baked bun with ajous for dipping.   The tavern decor was enhanced by walls of television sets that were tuned to every sports broadcast available.  The table service was fast and highly efficient and you'll find there's plenty of free off-street parking available.   The next time you're heading south of Phoenix and need food and beverages, then Cold beers and cheeseburgers will be a welcome stop, a simple refuel solution.  Salute!

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. The cheeseburger
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cheeseburger and tater tots.
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. Prime rib dip and salad

cCQggYidoUbQ8rWoX70bPA.text: Food was good, but really overpriced. The French Dip Sandwich was $16.95 which much higher than this type of sandwich would normally cost, but I figured what the heck I'm give it a try. It must be really good for that type of price.  When I ordered the waitress and me what type of side I would like and I asked for the fries. She then told me there is a $2 up charge.... FOR FRIES! I can buy a bag of potatoes for $4. Again, I said what the heck... I'm sure it with be worth it with my sandwich. What arrived was a small tin of fries, and a sandwich that was more bread than meat. Not worth the cost, and truthfully insulting. Unfortunately, this will be my second and last visit here. I'm not sure who does the pricing, but they should really take a look at the local market and compare prices.

IbZCTGnfAYE6qMD4epNKSQ.text: They advertise as having over 10 beers which is not only odd to advertise because 10 is not even a lot but also because it's a huge understatement. They have quite a huge selection of beers. But I'd say that their bottle and can list appears better than their draught.  Their service is alright. Not too long of a wait for anything but they *seemed* understaffed with only one waitress when in fact as I left the restaurant there were three girls (not including the waitress) chatting up in the front.  The food is half good half alright. All burgers come with 1/2lb patty that's cooked pretty darn well (ordered medium rare). I ordered the Mmmac & cheeseburger trying to get the best of both worlds since burgers and mac & cheese seemed to be their specialties. But the mac and cheese part was lackluster and bland.

fPT5ktH-_Ags-2I6hDDjyQ.text: Good burgers, assumed the beer is also cold. Went here for lunch during a workday so could not verify the coldness of the beer but I think it's a safe assumption.   Had the 1000 Island Burger and it was tasty with a side of chips (why no fries, friends?). My brother tried the PB&J burger. It looked super messy and he ate it all so Im guessing he liked it well enough.  Burger Challenge!? I don't know why but I love the novelty of a burger challenge (eat x patties in under y time for life-long bragging rights and a cheaper tab). I may have to attempt one day and then I can finally say I've accomplished something in my life when I crush the fastest time on the board.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. 1000 Island Burger, chips

BxJYNQmtuLIYoKLbifWPEQ.text: I'm usually here for happy hour going into the weekends and the vibe for lunch is the complete opposite!!! I'm used to parking far away and eyeing a table or booth when I come in... Not today and not for lunch. Low key Tuesday lunch with the fellas so I kept it simple with the Jucy Lucy and fries. Jucy Lucy has the cheese inside the burger. Recommendation next time, let the burger cool as I like to cut in half and most of my cheese was flowing off my burger to my plate. Some of the other burgers have some serious heat, but I wasn't ready to handle that without a beer or cocktail for but I had to get a side of the garlic aioli which is rich and creamy and is used for my spread on the burger and dip for my fries.   The happy hour and sports viewing are what makes this place good. It's really about the name... cold beers & burgers... they have plenty of specialty burgers and it's nice to mix them up with a topping from one to add to another. No beer on tap for us today as we were returning to the office, but it's clear how the 2 complement one another.  Service was cool and the recommendations helped. Took a while for our food to arrive and when it did I was surprised that the fries were just luke warm.   Could of been better...

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. Jucy Lucy with a side of garlic aioli
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States

vD70p8OBZmx0yLeqrvUS5g.text: First time at this location .. it was crowded when we arrived but we were seated right away.. server was quick to bring water and take drink orders..   We ordered fried pickles to start but they were out.. our waitress recommended the buffalo chicken tot chos .. yummy bar food!! Tator tots covered in buffalo chicken, buffalo sauce, blue cheese and ranch.. we'll definitely have these again..  I had the bacon blue burger medium.. it's huge .. like I couldn't get a bite of the whole burger huge... with a side of chips..   Our food arrived two minutes after our tots arrived and we hadn't even started to dig in yet .. so the manager comped the tots .. yay!!   Overall great service, lots of tv's, lots of drink options, good food, plenty of parking .. we'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bacon blue burger &amp; chips
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. Buffalo Chicken Tot Chos (amazing!!)

GGGr8zJzQDnFjd81p2mkvw.text: Horrible service. We got our drinks fast but sat here for 20 minutes with no attention to our table, so decided to leave. Don't think I'd give this place another try.

4ygXBtVdgfbiXD638fKjvg.text: Great place.  Will be back!!!  Fantastic food, spectacular atmosphere!!  This was a short notice dinner, no wait to be seated. Fun people watching.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. THAT GUY...He&#39;s an expert on everything...just ask him.
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. Happy Hour Menu
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Chandler, AZ, United States. Bar area.

B7xYZl0qAUyS5RIBw0Z8TQ.text: My wife and I have really enjoyed going here in the past with our daughters, but tonight was far from what we have experienced in previous visits. We felt rushed from the moment we sat down by our server, Tay. After we ordered our food, which didn't come out as ordered, we were nearly finished with our meals by the time we were checked on (by anyone, let alone our server). By then our drinks were empty and we were ready to leave lI asked for the check and nearly 20 minutes later she came back to collect payment.   I understand that servers get behind when it's busy, but that was not the case tonight. I have seen this place much more busy on a Friday night and had flawless service, tonight was a joke.   **After getting a response on this review from Tatum, who I assume is a manager, I responded in email as requested. I have yet to get a reply. Why ask me to email you if you're not going to respond? Not sure if they just do it to "save face" with the public, but I have yet to go back to this location due to the unprofessionalism. Which is too bad because it is the closest location to my home in Chandler.

lFJpRCynGkKxiXnCzOCb_Q.text: My friends and I come here almost every week. Unfortunately that will not be the case any more. We arrived at 6:40 and now it is 7:44 and we are still waiting on our food. Our waitress got one of our orders wrong and when asked she responded with, "did you ask me?" Lololol! Her epic quest to get me a club soda took a shocking 20 minutes. Anyway we were in a good mood and I normally don't write reviews but tonight is hysterical and I feel the need to share. Go somewhere else and avoid the service. Oh I'm done writing now, still waiting on that club soda!

aNVKAsVLDPztF7SwksZlOg.text: Wow! Delicious food overall and good costumer service. There must be a secret sauce to seasoning the asparagus and tomato appetizer. Burgers were cooked perfectly to our preferences and they had the worlds BEST onion rings. I could've eaten just a plate of onion rings and would been satisfied with my meal. When your onion rings are so good that you don't want to dip them in ketchup, you know they are the bomb!!

uV7K3ustBk406_0CQeBo1w.text: Food is really great!  Service is terrible. At the peak of the lunch time there are only about 2 servers?  Caroline was not very friendly or attentive to our large group. Maybe she was overwhelmed??

vrj34SPSdwXgwOc3bnqrNw.text: I've been here a few times and ways do a burger and it's always been pretty good. Nothing too special but always pretty good. Had the Nashville Hot chicken this time around and was less then impressed. It's actually laughable that they advertise it with a flame Indicating  "No refund if you can't handle it" No heat at all, noting but an uninspiring buffalo mild sauce. Calling this Nashville Hot Chicken is an embarrassment to Nashville.

O9UNeHzLoCQqF-4fXJTTTg.text: I love the Juicy Lucy ... can't go wrong with a burger filled with cheese!  The bartender has a great friendly personality that makes your experience even more enjoyable

8uPlkNn3gxcT_B1yOZ7HGw.text: I would come here again for the flat screen TV's playing NHL games and the beer list but certainly not for the food. I got the Reuben and the meat tasted super processed and salty; almost like a hot dog. 6 hours later I still have indigestion from it. Service was good.
